sentence.Network_en: The next hearings will be structured differently in order to minimize the inquisitorial atmosphere.
sentence.Network_cn: 下次听证会将以不同的方式进行，以尽可能淡化审判似的气氛。

sentence.Network_en: The press was inquisitorial to the point of antagonism.
sentence.Network_cn: 报纸追根究底,几乎达到了敌对的地步.

sentence.Network_en: An English information was inquisitorial in nature.
sentence.Network_cn: 英格兰诉讼本质上是调查审问式的.

PerfectNetExp.abs: 英语新词汇与常用词汇的翻译(I) ... inquisitor 询问者 inquisitorial 询问人的 inquisitress 女审讯者.
韩国的纠问式（inquisitorial ）“书面审理”在很大程度上只是法庭对审判前证词和政府（公诉机关）提供的证据的确认，没有为有意义 …
法庭口译学习日志-1_Dorra_新浪博客 ... initiate 开始，发动 inquisitorial 纠问式的 institute verb. 创立，制定.
中国的法律制度是建立在罗马法的纠问制（Inquisitorial），即强调法官的作用。法官积极介入审理案件，从发现接受证据到审问裁决 …

list.abs: 职权主义(inquisitorial system)： 控审分离，检察官起诉，不告不理，法官主导并依职权调查证据（“控告人如果成为法官，就需要上帝 …
...、检合一，由裁判机关自行开始诉讼程序并为主体之古纠问制度(inquisitorial system)，使丧失法官中立性，损害公平法院理念云云。
（二） 纠问式诉讼 （ inquisitorial procedure ）→封建制1．含义：案件的审理不公开进行，不允许当事人在法庭上辩论，判决主要以 …

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 18th cent.: from medieval Latin inquisitorius (from Latin inquisitor, from inquirere 'inquire') + -al

entry.tran: 审判(官)似的;寻根究底的;爱查问的
entry.def: If you describe something or someone as inquisitorial, you mean they resemble things or people in an inquisition.

example.ex: The next hearings will be structured differently in order to minimize the inquisitorial atmosphere.
example.tran: 下次听证会将以不同的方式进行,以尽可能淡化审判似的气氛。

means.word_mean: 1. especially indicating a form of prosecution in which proceedings are secret and the accused is questioned by a prosecutor who acts also as the judge
2. marked by inquisitive interest; especially suggestive of an ecclesiastical inquisitor;

sentences.sentence: "the press was inquisitorial to the point of antagonism"
"a practical police force with true inquisitorial talents"- Waldo Frank

means.word_mean: 3. having the authority to conduct official investigations;

auth_sentence.content: Government officials, he said, are asking BP officials tough questions in sessions he described as "inquisitorial".
